alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 08 at 6:28PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Increasing Probability Of A Series Of Impactful Storms Sunday Through Thursday... There is increasing probability for a series of Bering Sea storms to impact the West Coast and Western Interior from Sunday through Thursday. The first system will bring a strong front to the West Coast on Sunday with heavy snow, south, southeast, and southwest winds gusting as high as 50 mph, and snow possibly changing to rain late Sunday. At this time elevated water levels are possible, though likely to be higher with the second system. A second, stronger system looks to impact the region Tuesday through Thursday. This system will bring the possibility of coastal flooding with the highest water levels likely south of the Bering Strait, as well as heavy snow potentially changing to rain, and south and southwest winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Water levels are still highly uncertain and will be tracked closely going into this weekend. There is still significant uncertainty with both storm systems, and residents should stay alert for additional updates to the forecast and prepare for stormy weather late this weekend into next week.
